etymologies: mid 18th century; earliest use found in John Byrom (1692–1763), poet and creator of a system of shorthand. From Byzantine Greek ἐνθεασμός from ancient Greek ἐνθεάζειν to be inspired or possessed by a god + -μός, suffix forming nouns

definitions: The state or condition of being possessed or inspired by a divine power; divine inspiration. In later use, especially with reference to the Neoplatonic philosophy of Plotinus: a divine trance; religious ecstasy.
